texts.value: Strength has solved all of your problems. There's nothing you can't tough out. Any pain you endure rewards you twice over.
The mystical nature of this world unravels at the snap of your fingers. Some call this intelligence. You call it imagination.
Your dexterity knows no bounds. Playing the piano, starting a fire, and killing a man with a bow and arrow. It's all the same.
Quick, silent, and lucky. The only people who remember your face are the ones who see it before entering the gates of heaven.
There's something oddly charming about a vast expanse full of nothing. Somewhat like a blank canvas.
A few cracks here and there, but you doubt this stone path has ever needed maintenance.
The air feels so empty. If it weren't for the cold breeze every now and then, you'd forget it even existed.
You gaze up at the black sky. It would be more enjoyable if there was a starker contrast between it and the ground.
You've been ambushed. They look hungry.
The Unkindled need to eat too.
There was something hiding in the dirt. They attack.
And that's another reason why you need to get home.
You scavenge through their remains for anything useful.
The Unkindled are no match for you.
A bit roughed up, but you can keep going.
You shout loudly and scare them off.
Apparently strong winds created the mounds and swept up entire roads. Folktales are hard to believe.
Sometimes you hear low pitched snarling. At least you think you do.
It must have been difficult laying down rocks in the middle of nowhere. Who built these roads?
You stop at the peaks to look for the flames of Umaria. But you see nothing but more wasteland.
You've been ambushed. They look hungry.
Living in the wastes isn't easy.
The hills are slowing you down. You've been followed.
Best not to linger here for too long.
You scavenge through their remains for anything useful.
The rugged terrain has made them tough. You're tougher.
The hobgoblin points at the Umaria banner before collapsing.
It was brave enough to fight you, but not brave enough to run.
It plants its sword in the ground one last time. A sign of respect?
You shout loudly and scare them off.

Rivers replaced with dirt. Cattle replaced with Unkindled. 
Clouds replaced with nothing.
An occasional strong wind kicks the dirt up. Covering your mouth and shielding your eyes, you continue walking aimlessly.
All of this for your sister. Is this worth it?
You've been lost, and now you've been found.
If only there was somewhere to hide.
The Unkindled aren't the only ones who can kill.
You'll die if you stay out here.
The fresh carcasses will draw more Unkindled.
The Unkindled are sensitive to heat and sound. They'll find you again.
You kick up some dirt and run.
A gust of wind throws off their senses.
You're not the only one who's afraid to die.
With the alpha dead, the pack scatters.
Their leader is no more. And neither is their home.
They greyhides were ruled by strength. But they won't follow you.
Even the greyhides mourn their own. The irony.
There was no where to hide.
An undetected pack of greyhides wandered close to you. You dive behind the nearest mound. Did they hear you?
You see a bag dropped by someone wandering the wastes.
A lonely outpost is standing in the distance.
The Grey Wastes were aptly named. Only fools dare travel these lands. Looks like this is the start of the path.
A fork in the road. The right looks easier to travel.
There's a recently used outpost nearby. Unkindled might be close.
Stingers paralyze their prey and store them for later in burrows. There might be something useful. There might be someone home.
You find what was left after their last meal. Something shiny caught your eye deeper in. Is it worth the risk?
Larger tombs represent mass burials. Make a prayer?
Smarter goblins band together and stash whatever they find between some rocks. There doesn't seem to be anyone home.
There's a large amount of copper scraps in the pile. The sounds of the metal clinking together could alert nearby goblins.
The path has ended. An endless desert is all that stands between you and Umaria. This won't be easy.
Unkindled aren't very wasteful. Maybe there's still something here?
A violent storm of dirt will be passing over you soon.
A large rock blocks the road.
A large rock blocks the road.
A large rock blocks the road.
You stand inside a crude bunker. In front of you, a large goblin sits on a stone throne. Unlike most of their kind, it looks brave.
Large packs of greyhides will dig out dens beside areas with lots of food. Only the strongest greyhides can maintain these dens.
You limp back on to the path.
The battle with the alpha was too much. The blood from your wounds soaks through your clothes. As long as the oil vial is unscathed...
You see it. Umaria. The last of humanity's strongholds. Your body is barely moving. But the candle light. The light of her eyes.
You collapse at the gate. You hear a lot of shouting. The gate opening. Someone crying. And then nothing.
Whoever left this won't be needing it anymore.
You lie quietly against the dirt and pray. After a moment you look back. The pack is walking away.
You try to hide but they hear your movements. One runs up and bites.
Sometimes you just can't take risks.
The warmth is rejuvenating. Its as if your youth has returned to you.
The magic of the fire can bring anyone back from the brink.
The fire is nice. But you can't help but feel watched.
There's no rest for the wicked.
How long will you stay concious for this time?
Who would pass on a free meal?
You found nothing. The stingers found you.
Only a stinger's eyes can shine inside their burrow.
You grabbed everything you could. Should probably leave now.
You found nothing. Not the worst outcome.
The tomb resonates. You feel better.
Nothing happened. A waste of time.
The stone lights up. There's something lying at your feet.
The tomb glows. An oddly shaped charm is hanging around your neck.
You wait a bit but nothing happens. Maybe your prayers will be answered in the afterlife.
The stone shimmers. There's a cloak wrapped around you.
The tomb flashes white. A wraith's cloak falls before you.
No one protected the wraiths. Why should they protect you?
A cold wind passes over you. A sign that you should probably leave.
The markings on the tomb start to glow. Something is in your pockets.
The tomb emits some kind of light. Oddly shaped coins are in your hands.
You idle at the rock. Your prayers have gone unanswered. Not the first time this has happened to you.
The pile is worthless, but you notice its sitting on top of some good condition rags.
You inspect the goblin's crude hut, only to see a pile of garbage.
You sift through their pile and find a lot of useful trinkets.
Nothing but old bones and dirt.
There's a bit of meat left behind. Probably not the best to eat.
Some of the bones might be of use.
You brace against the current and slowly move forward. Any experience that does not kill you makes you stronger, right?
You attempt to stand your ground, but the wind is too much. A strong gust picks you off your feet and carries you with the storm.

You're not strong enough to brave the storm.
Dirt, rocks, and remains pelt you to the ground
This storm isn't the worst. It passes over you peacefully.
The sky turns grey as you're consumed by dust and dirt. The winds are furious and drag you in their direction.

You find a small hill and lay flat against it.
Soon enough, you can see the sky again.
You push the rock with all of your might and move it off the road. An experience that will help future travelers.

You push with all of your strength against the rock,
but all you do is waste time.

The rock is too suspicious. Leave it to someone
with more time on their hands to move it out of the way.

With your keen intellect, you are able to discern
that it is just an ordinary rock.
You glance at the rock from a distance, but fail to notice anything.
You go to push the rock. While giving it your all, a group of goblins appear from behind it and claw at you.
You go to walk around the rock. Right as you step off the path, a band of goblins jump up from behind it and pelt at you with rocks.

There's subtle claw markings on the rock.
Goblins are probably hiding for an ambush.
You glance at the rock from a distance, but fail to notice anything.

You take a running start and leap over the rock.
The goblins are startled.
You shove the rock over to the side of the road. There's a hole leading to some rudimentary bunker.
The rock is surprisingly heavy. Even with your best efforts, it doesn't budge. You're wasting time.
She needs you right now. Get going.
There's nothing special about the rock. However, the ground beneath it seems unnatural.
You glance at the rock from a distance, but fail to notice anything.
Other goblins rush to stand by their champion.
This skill will be visible once there is at least one skill enabled in the previous column
Magical attack with a high chance to burn
Draw an enemy's attention and anger towards yourself
Damage taken from random events is halved
Restore 25% of physical damage dealt as MP
Weak magical attack with a decent chance to freeze
Mana regeneration while travelling is doubled
Burn chance on attacks is doubled
Taking 20% of caster's MATK as magic damage at the end of its turn
Losing 7% of its max HP at the end of its turn
Has PATK increased by 50% and must attack the caster when it can
Has DOG, ACC, and PDEF reduced by 30%
HP is being drained equal to 40% of caster's PATK at the end of its turn
Has CRIT and DOG increased by 50%
Curious wanderers of the wastes. Who knows where it found its clothes.
Goblin that was inspired by the warrior it killed.
They like to hunt in packs, preying on the weakest.
Its eyes reflect what little light there is to lure in prey.
Malevolent souls of those who died under false promises.
Reanimated hand that became as cursed as the spirit that took control of it.
Feral beasts that live for the smell of blood.
A single bite and they can siphon off all of a victim's blood.
All it takes to be their alpha is brute strength and a bit more brain.
